warn.lucidity.photosensitive-seizure-war:
Photosensitive seizure warning
A very small percentage of people may experience a seizure when exposed to certain visual images, including flashing lights or patterns that may appear in video games. Even people who have no history of seizures or epilepsy may have an undiagnosed condition that can cause these “photosensitive epileptic seizures” while playing video games.
Immediately stop playing and consult a doctor if you experience any symptoms.
These seizures may have a variety of symptoms, including lightheadedness, altered vision, eye or face twitching, jerking or shaking of arms or legs, disorientation, confusion, or momentary loss of awareness. Seizures may also cause loss of consciousness or convulsions that can lead to injury from falling down or striking nearby objects.
Parents should watch for or ask their children about the above symptoms. Children and teenagers are more likely than adults to experience these seizures.
You may reduce risk of photosensitive epileptic seizures by taking the following precautions:
1.Play in a well-lit room.
2.Do not play if you are drowsy or fatigued.
If you or any of your relatives have a history of seizures or epilepsy, consult a doctor before playing video games.
config.lucidity.title: Lucidity
config.lucidity.description.selectiveRen: Render only blocks, entities, and particles that players wish to render.
config.lucidity.description.spectator_se: Selection in spectator mode without wand.
config.lucidity.description.wand:
Specify the wand item by entering its name.
Example: minecraft:blaze_rod
In Survival mode, the wand can select regions without blocking entity or block interactions.
In Creative mode, the wand can select regions but blocks entity or block interactions.
Left-click with the wand to select an area; right-click to select a specific block type.
Ctrl + left-click adds to the selection, and Shift + left-click removes unfinished selections.
config.lucidity.description.wand_apply: Specify whether the wand's selection is applied to blocks, entities, or particles for selective rendering.
config.lucidity.should_add_area: Both points are recorded. press addSelection key to add a region.
config.lucidity.cant_add_area: Please complete the selection of Points 1 and 2 before adding a region.
config.lucidity.render_mode.render_both_: Render specific content both inside and outside
Exclude specific content both inside and outside
config.lucidity.wand.selectP1: Left-click: Select point1 of the area.
config.lucidity.wand.selectP2: Right-click: Select point2 of the area.
config.lucidity.description.keyPresses: Render Key-Presses at bottom right corner of the screen.
config.lucidity.description.damageIndica: Simply indicates the location of the damage source.
The amount by which the damage indicator is offset from the center of the screen.
config.lucidity.damageIndicator.time: Time the damage indicator stays on the screen.
config.lucidity.description.heighLightLa: Gives lava source a different highlight texture.(resources/lucidity/textures/block/lava_flow & lava_still)
